basketball

Class Court

  • java.lang.Object
    • basketball.Court

  • public class Court
extends java.lang.Object
    The Court class develops the details of how the court and its pieces are designed. This class includes multiple methods which are referred to throughout the package which help with events such as getting initializing both players at a certain x and y coordinate, updating scoreboard graphics after a score, and calculating distance between players or player and hoop. All of this is done within the Court class because data such as court height, court width, the player array and the reset method are all stored in this class.
    Version:
    May 25, 2019
    Author:
    Lakshay Maharana, Sunhoo Ahn, Shree Phadke, Period: 3, Assignment: Game, Sources:

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int p1score 
      static int p2score 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Court()
      This is the constructor for the Court class which involves establishing the width and height initializing each player and the ball onto the court on a certain x and y coordinate, and also sets each player to a certain index in the players array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void changePoss()
      If a player has posession of the ball, the boolean value of the respective player's hasBall is made true, else false if they do not have possession.
      static void checkScore()
      This method keeps track of the players' scores and decides what player gets the ball after the shot has been made.
      void drawScore1(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This helper method sets the image of the scoreboard depending on how many points the player score.
      void drawScore2(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This helper method sets the image of the scoreboard depending on how many points the player score.
      static basketball.Ball getBall()
      The getter method for the ball object.
      static int getHeight()
      The getter method for the court's height.
      static basketball.Player getLoser()
      This method compares the scores between Player 1 and Player 2 to determine who is the loser.
      static basketball.Player[] getPlayer()
      The getter method for the array of Player objects.
      java.awt.Image getScore1()
      This method returns the image corresponding to the number of points Player 1 has scored in the game and it is the same image that shows up on the scoreboard.
      java.awt.Image getScore2()
      This method returns the image corresponding to the number of points Player 2 has scored in the game and it is the same image that shows up on the scoreboard.
      static int getWidth()
      The getter method for the court's width.
      static basketball.Player getWinner()
      This method compares the scores between Player 1 and Player 2 to determine who is the winner.
      static int getXDistance()
      This method calculate the horizontal distance between the two players using their getX methods and is designed to be a helper method for the Player class's methods such as collide() as the method depends on using the players' distance to set boundaries.
      static int getYDistance()
      This method calculate the vertical distance between the two players using their getY methods and is designed to be a helper method for the Player class's methods such as collide() as the method depends on using the players' distance to set boundaries.
      static int hoopXDistance()
      This method calculates the distance between the player who possesses the ball and the x coordinate 1220, which is the center of the hoop and is a helper method for the Player class's methods such as collide().
      static int hoopYDistance()
      This method calculates the distance between the player who possesses the ball and the y coordinate 231, which is the center of the hoop.
      static void reset()
      When the ball is in the hoop, as in the player has scored, this method resets the players' positions depending on who won the point.
      java.awt.Image scoredDisplay()
      This method returns the image that says "SCORE!" when a player makes a shot and is designed to be a helper method that the GUI class calls when the ball enters the hoop.
      static basketball.Player who()
      This method simply returns the player who is in possession of the ball.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Court

        public Court()
        This is the constructor for the Court class which involves establishing the width and height initializing each player and the ball onto the court on a certain x and y coordinate, and also sets each player to a certain index in the players array.

    • Method Detail

      • drawScore1

        public void drawScore1(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This helper method sets the image of the scoreboard depending on how many points the player score. The method is called in the GUI class and adjusts the image of the RED scoreboard depending on how many points the player scores.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object which draws the scoreboard graphics

      • drawScore2

        public void drawScore2(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This helper method sets the image of the scoreboard depending on how many points the player score. The method is called in the GUI class and adjusts the image of the BLUE scoreboard depending on how many points the player scores.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object which draws the scoreboard graphics

      • scoredDisplay

        public java.awt.Image scoredDisplay()
        This method returns the image that says "SCORE!" when a player makes a shot and is designed to be a helper method that the GUI class calls when the ball enters the hoop.
        Returns:
        the Image object scored which is a large green banner with the text "SCORE!"

      • getScore1

        public java.awt.Image getScore1()
        This method returns the image corresponding to the number of points Player 1 has scored in the game and it is the same image that shows up on the scoreboard. This is a helper method that is called in the GUI class when developing the scoreboard's graphics.
        Returns:
        the Image object which has the correct number corresponding to the score Player 1 has

      • getScore2

        public java.awt.Image getScore2()
        This method returns the image corresponding to the number of points Player 2 has scored in the game and it is the same image that shows up on the scoreboard. This is a helper method that is called in the GUI class when developing the scoreboard's graphics.
        Returns:
        the Image object which has the correct number corresponding to the score Player 2 has

      • getWinner

        public static basketball.Player getWinner()
        This method compares the scores between Player 1 and Player 2 to determine who is the winner.
        Returns:
        The player object of the player with a higher score is returned as a result of this method.

      • getLoser

        public static basketball.Player getLoser()
        This method compares the scores between Player 1 and Player 2 to determine who is the loser.
        Returns:
        The player object of the player with a lower score is returned as a result of this method.

      • getXDistance

        public static int getXDistance()
        This method calculate the horizontal distance between the two players using their getX methods and is designed to be a helper method for the Player class's methods such as collide() as the method depends on using the players' distance to set boundaries.
        Returns:
        The method returns the horizontal distance between the two players as an integer

      • getYDistance

        public static int getYDistance()
        This method calculate the vertical distance between the two players using their getY methods and is designed to be a helper method for the Player class's methods such as collide() as the method depends on using the players' distance to set boundaries.
        Returns:
        The method returns the vertical distance between the two players as an integer

      • hoopXDistance

        public static int hoopXDistance()
        This method calculates the distance between the player who possesses the ball and the x coordinate 1220, which is the center of the hoop and is a helper method for the Player class's methods such as collide().
        Returns:
        The method returns difference in x coordinates between the hoop and the offensive player's x coordinates.

      • hoopYDistance

        public static int hoopYDistance()
        This method calculates the distance between the player who possesses the ball and the y coordinate 231, which is the center of the hoop. The method is a helper method for the Player class's methods such as getShotChance() because the method relies on calculating shot probability based on the distance between the player and hoop.
        Returns:
        The method returns difference in y coordinates between the hoop and the offensive player's y coordinates.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        When the ball is in the hoop, as in the player has scored, this method resets the players' positions depending on who won the point. For example, if player B steals the ball from player A and makes, the new reset positions will display player B with the ball and player A guarding and vice versa.

      • who

        public static basketball.Player who()
        This method simply returns the player who is in possession of the ball.
        Returns:
        player that has the ball

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth()
        The getter method for the court's width.
        Returns:
        width of the court

      • getHeight

        public static int getHeight()
        The getter method for the court's height.
        Returns:
        height of the court

        public static basketball.Player[] getPlayer()
        The getter method for the array of Player objects.
        Returns:
        array of players

        public static basketball.Ball getBall()

        Returns:
        ball

      • checkScore

        public static void checkScore()
        This method keeps track of the players' scores and decides what player gets the ball after the shot has been made.

      • changePoss

        public static void changePoss()
        If a player has posession of the ball, the boolean value of the respective player's hasBall is made true, else false if they do not have possession.
